sentences.sentence: Two British-made armored vehicles arrive in Donbass as the first of many thousands of Ukrainian soldiers arrive in the UK for training.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The EU and Morocco have renewed a migration agreement after dozens of people died trying to jump over a fence at the border with Spain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Sri Lanka's president and prime minister have agreed to resign after tens of thousands of protesters have rocked the country's capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Moments after the prime minister made his announcement, protesters set his private house on fire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And earlier that same day, demonstrators successfully stormed the president's residence, a feat that injured at least 34 people, including two police officers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A lawyer at the protest told reporters, at the moment, I think the people's struggle is moving successfully.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And I wish all the best for the struggle. And at the end, we will make a good change for our country." Demonstrators have been calling for both the country's president and its prime minister to resign for months as Sri Lanka deals with its worst economic crisis in decades.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Its severe foreign exchange shortage has limited its imports of essential items, such as medicine, food and fuel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Protesters blame the country's president for the deteriorating situation, and they accuse the prime minister of protecting the president when demonstrators started calling for his resignation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Prime Minister Renil Reckamensinge said he would step down after lawmakers agreed on a new government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Two British-made armoured personnel carriers have arrived at the front line in the Donbass region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But a Ukrainian commander said the country's army needs many more tanks to match Russia's firepower.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We need tanks, howitzers and a lot of long-range artillery.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, the first group of Ukrainian recruits have arrived in the UK to be trained by the British army.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: UK officials are aiming to train up to 10,000 recruits every four months at four different training bases across the country, preparing them to face the Russian Army.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Training matters. When you're in a war and you're against Russia, you need to make sure that you can be as best as you can be. And this is the process we're doing here. We're starting to deliver that. Moscow claims that Russian forces had destroyed a hangar filled with equipment sent by the U.S. Near the town of Shasiv Yar, a high-precision weapon of the Russian forces had destroyed a hangar filled with equipment sent by the US.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Near the town of Shasyvyar, a high-precision weapon of the Russian forces destroyed a hangar with American M777 howitzers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In the Kramatorsk direction, the enemy shelled civilian infrastructure in Holivka and Vernoyansk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Ukrainian army, meanwhile, said that Russia was continuing to shell civilian infrastructure in several regions in eastern Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The governor of the Luhansk region said that Russian forces are managing to raise true hell in Ukraine's industrial heartland.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Delays and cancellations are plaguing airports across Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In Budapest, the number of passengers using its airport has nearly reached pre-COVID levels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The number of flights with more than an hour delay has doubled, and cancellations are not rare.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Like in many other airports, staff shortages are a major part of the problem.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A communications director at Budapest Airport said that we also face challenges from ground handling companies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They are all airline partners.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They are the ones who do the check-in, boarding and baggage handling, among other things.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They are the ones here in Hungary, but especially internationally, where there is a very big labor shortage, especially for baggage handlers. And of course, if you don't have someone to service the plane, it will be late." In Paris, around 10 percent of flights at Charles de Gaulle Airport were cancelled at the end of June, in part because of a strike by ground personnel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And in London's Heathrow Airport, hundreds of suitcases piled up because of a strike by ground personnel. And in London's Heathrow airport, hundreds of suitcases piled up because of a problem with its baggage system.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The situation is much worse in the UK where because of another equally stupid policy, which was Brexit, they now can't recruit young Europeans to do these jobs that British people don't want to do.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: So the UK airports, I think, will continue to be short-staffed and we're seeing suffering a lot of air traffic control delays and airport delays.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Staff at several airports and airlines across Europe have gone on strike as both are understaffed because of COVID-19 and many workers are demanding better working conditions and better pay as demand for travel increases.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Tributes and condolences have been pouring in from around the world after Japan's longest serving leader Shinsu Abe was fatally shot on Friday at a political rally. India and Nepal have announced one day of national mourning as a mark of respect. Residents and news media lined the streets as the hearse carrying Abe's body left his home in Tokyo on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This resident says he had contributed and could have contributed so much more to the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: This would be a great loss for Japan.

sentences.sentence: This man says, it is unbelievable to see an attack like this in very safe Japan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It is unbelievable that someone was walking around with a gun like that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The alleged gunman, who is in police custody, has admitted shooting the former Prime Minister and says he was harbouring a grudge.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Speaking at the G20 summit in Indonesia, Josep Borre, the EU's foreign policy chief, offered his sympathies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Well, we are all shocked.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Abe was the most long-standing minister of Japan, a good friend of Europe. He contributed a lot to the friendship between Japan and the European Union and to the world progress and stability.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08

sentences.sentence: I'd like to say just a very few words about the horrific, shocking killing of my friend Japanese Prime Minister Abe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Thousands of trail seekers participate in the famous runs that usually last around two and a half minutes. At least seven men were taken to the hospital after Saturday's run.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: However, the six Spaniards and one Frenchman were not seriously injured. Others were stomped over by the half dozen bulls and the six oxen that are used in the festival. It was a moment of firsts for Elena Rybakina. On Saturday, the 23-year-old tennis player won the women's final for her first Grand Slam. It was also the first time her adopted country, Kazakhstan, has received the first singles trophy. She is also the youngest woman to win the title since 2011. Rybakina is originally from Moscow, but she has been representing Kazakhstan since 2018.
